title: Songs X
text:
the hills
like poets put on
purple thought against
the

magnificent clamor of
                        day
tortured
in gold,which presently

crumpled
collapses
exhaling a red soul into the dark

so
duneyed master
enter
the sweet gates

                   of my heart and
take
the
rose,

which perfect
is
With killing hands
seo_description: A poem by E. E. Cummings in “XLI Poems”
